EmailTemplate.description: Explains to staff member (PL,APL,SW&CM) how they will be paid, if they are not receiving an advance
EmailTemplate.name: 2.4.5a Autumn Payment Email
EmailTemplate.subject: Payment schedule for your role on NCS with The Challenge
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Please do not respond to this email. This email was sent from an unattended mailbox, and replies are not reviewed. Please instead contact your staffing representative on {!Job_placement__c.Staffing_Associate_email__c}.
Dear {!Job_placement__c.Contact_Name__c},
Congratulations on being appointed as {!Job_placement__c.Role__c} on NCS with The Challenge on {!Job_placement__c.Wave__c}.
The pay for your autumn role will be {!Job_placement__c.Total_gross_pay__c} for work between the dates of {!Job_placement__c.Assignment_start_date__c} and {!Job_placement__c.Assignment_end_date__c}. This payment covers a total of {!Job_placement__c.Standard_days_for_role__c} working days.
This includes pay for {!Job_placement__c.Annual_Leave_entitlement__c} day(s) “Holiday Period” per Wave Contract which is subject to tax and national insurance deductions.
Your first pay date is 19 November where you will receive your pay for the first three elements of the programme (NCS: Personal Challenge, NCS: Team Challenge and NCS: Real Challenge Design). One or more of these will be applicable to your role.
On the 16 December you will receive your pay for the NCS: Real Challenge Action and Graduation elements of the programme (if applicable to your role). For each NCS: RCA and/or Graduation day you work, you will receive {!Job_placement__c.Standard_daily_rate__c}.This is also subject to tax and NI deductions.
This payment structure has two principles:
To ensure that staff members pay the appropriate level of tax in the correct month;
To enable staff members to receive payment in reasonable time.
If you have any further questions about your payment schedule please contact your staffing associate quoting the email reference number in any correspondence.
Best wishes,
NCS with The Challenge
CR 2.4.5a
